        public static java.lang.Class<?> decodeClass(java.lang.String className)

        Attempt to load a class from the given className.

        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to load, must be in the format package.class.
        Returns:
        The resulting class, or null.

      • decodeObject

        public static java.lang.Object decodeObject(java.lang.String type,
                                            java.lang.String value)

        Attempt to decode an object from the given type and value.

        Valid object types are:

        • boolean
        • byte
        • int
        • float
        • double
        • long
        • enum
        • vector2
        • vector3
        • vector4
        • quaternion
        • color
        • asset

        It's worth noting that the expected format of these types can differ.

        enum expects the value to be in a package.class#index format, where index is the enum value index.

        vector2, vector3, vector4, quaternion and color expect the value to be separated by comments, for example: x, y, z, w for vector4 and quaternion.

        assets will be passed to Assets.load(String), so a path is expected.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of the object, this can only be from a set of predefined values.
        value - The target value.
        Returns:
        The resulting object. It must be manually cast to the expected type.
